title: What is the difference between @Component and @Bean?

answers.junior: @Component is for classes, @Bean is for methods in configuration classes. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: @Component enables auto-detection via classpath scanning. @Bean explicitly declares bean in configuration class. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. @Component for your classes, @Bean for third-party.
answers.senior: @Component is class-level stereotype for component scanning. @Bean is method-level in @Configuration for programmatic bean definition. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. @Bean allows customized instantiation logic.
